result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie K Harshman

defendant.name: Harshman, Stephanie K
defendant.address: 2748 US Highway 63 N PO Box 83, Barronett, WI 54813

records.addlTxt: Transcript - Sentencing Hearing, October 6th, 2022.

3:20 PM Defendant Stephanie K Harshman in court, in custody.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Stephanie K Harshman.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
This covers 22CF55, 21CF320, 21CF182, 22CF31. 

22CF55 - Defense believes the case will be dismissed and read-in. State relates and agrees. Court orders 22CF55 dismissed and read-in. 

No additions/corrections to jail. State relates regarding the PSI. Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court. 

Court relates and orders: 

21CF182 - Sentence withheld - 3 years probation consecutive to Count 1 in 21CF320 and Concurrent with Count 2 in 21CF320. 
2 days credit if revoked. 
Court costs - Cash bonds to be applied. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, including methamphetamine. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample. 

21CF320 - 
Count 1: 
1 year 6 months initial confinement. Court grants 32 days if revoked. 
Taycheedah Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. 
2 years extended supervision. 
Court costs - Cash bonds to be applied. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, including methamphetamine. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample. 

Count 2: Sentence withheld - 3 years probation consecutive to Count 1. 
Court costs - Cash bonds to be applied. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, including methamphetamine. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample. 


22CF31 - Sentence withheld - 3 years probation consecutive to Count 1 in 21CF320 and Concurrent with Count 2 in 21CF320, and 21CF182. 
119 days credit if revoked. 
Court costs - Cash bonds to be applied. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, including methamphetamine. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample. 

CC: BC Jail . Felony admonitions given, including firearms and voters rights. The following form was provided to the Defendant for signature: Notice and acknowledge of defendant's voting ineligibility. Appellate Rights,  A copy of the written explanation of determinate sentence was provided to the Defendant.

11:14 AM Defendant Stephanie K Harshman appeared by video, in custody from Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Stephanie K Harshman.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter appears by zoom. 

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 22CF55, 21CF182, 21CF320 AND 22CF31

11:18  Court relates and gives appearances.  All above cases reset.
DA to do writ.

(MS scanned to jail)
Arraignment scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Letter to Hon Judge regarding arraignment from Attorney Firkus.

1:28 PM Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Stephanie K Harshman not in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus did not appear for Stephanie K Harshman. 
1:35  Court relates and gives appearances..
Court resets to 9/06/2022 at 11:15 AM; must appear in person.
Arraignment scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Arraignment on July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.; sent to Defendant at BC Jail on 5/5/22

Preliminary Hearing Waived The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  
Court finds probable cause and binds over. 

Scan to jail
Arraignment scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 3, 2022 at 04:00 pm.; sent to Defendant at BC Jail on 4/29/22

01:04 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stephanie K Harshman appeared by video in custody.  Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by in person for Stephanie K Harshman. 
Defendants motion to amend the cash bond to signature bond and relates
State relates the number of files the defendant has and objects to the modification. 
Court denies the motion to amend the cash bond.  

Bond to continue. 

Scan to Jail.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on April 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.; sent to Defendant at BC Jail on 4/27/22

10:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stephanie K Harshman appeared by video, in custody. This covers cases 22CF55, 21CF68, 21CF182, & 21CM165.  Attorney Steuer relates counsel has not yet been obtained and requests a reset. All files set to 6/15/2022 at 10:00 AM.
Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Hearing on March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
NOH sent to Def at Barron Co Jail
Jail notified of hearing by email

10:00 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stephanie K Harshman in court and in custody. This covers cases 22CF55, 21CF68, 21CF182,21CF320, & 21CM165.  State relates.  Attorney Steuer relates DE does qualify for PD and counsel has not yet been appointed in these cases. DE relates regarding bond.  Court denies request to modify bond. Bond continues.  All cases set to 3/30/2022 at 10:00 AM.
Hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Stephanie K Harshman appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Michael J Steuer for Stephanie K Harshman appeared by video.
Covers 21CF68, 21CF182, 21CF320, 21CM165 and 22CF55
Qualifies for Public Defender but no attorney has been appointed.  Court finds good cause for adjournment.  Next hearing before Judge Bitney.  Defendant requests bond modification.  Court denies bond modification.
Hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report
Adjourned initial appearance on March 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.; sent to Defendant at BC Jail on 3/14/22

1:01 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Stephanie K Harshman appeared by video in custody. Attorney Dustin Rockow appears via zoom video.
Covers 21CF68, 21CF182, 21CF320, 21CM165 & 22CF55
Defendant qualifies for public defender.  An attorney will be appointed for the defendant.
Court finds good cause for adjournment of the preliminary examination in 22CF55.
All files will be reset to March 16, 2022 at 10 AM.

Defendant requests a bond modification to a signature bond.  
1:05 Court puts attorney and defendant in break-out room.
1:09 Attorney Rockow and defendant return.
Attorney Rockow requests a signature bond on 22CF55 and the cash bond remain on the other files.
State relates and objects to bond modification.
Defendant addresses the Court.
Rebuttal by State.
Court denies the motion to reduce the cash bond.

Minutes scanned to jail.
Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

12:59 PM Defendant Stephanie K Harshman appeared by video, Attorney John Michael O'Boyle for State of Wisconsin appeared in court.  Dustin Rockow appears for Defendant by video for today only.
COVERS 22CF55,21CF68,21CF182,21CF320 & 21CM165.
Court questions defendant on counsel.  Defendant relates.  Attorney Rockow relates. Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.   Court finds good cause for the adjournment.  All files reset to tomorrow.

SCANNED TO BARRON COUNTY JAIL

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:10 PM Defendant Stephanie K Harshman appeared by video, in custody.  No Attorney appears for Defendant. Attorney Brian H. Wright Aty appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
COVERS 22CF55 (INIT), 21CF182,21CF320,21CF68 & 21CM165 (WARRANTS).
PHONE NUMBER UPDATED IN 22CF55. Warrants quashed in 21CF182,21CF320,21CF68 & 21CM165.  Defendant relates Laura Sutton is appointed on other files and would like counsel appointed.  Court resets all files to tomorrow at 10:00 a.m. to give Defendant time to call the public defender's office.  Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.   Court relates they will likely appoint Laura Sutton to the new file, but will decide that issue tomorrow.


SCANNED TO BARRON COUNTY JAIL
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
